discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. A class is a recipe for an object
None of the other options are valid. If rephrased, option C could be correct for clarification (if focusing on unique attribute values per object rather than unique sets of attributes).
I'm not sure about C. Each object of the same class has the same set of properties but can have different values.

choices.A: encapsulation allows you to hide a whole class inside a package
choices.C: each object of the same class can have a different set of properties
choices.D: the arrows on a class diagram are always directed from a superclass towards its subclass
choices.B: a class is a recipe for an object

questions.question_text: What is true about Object-Oriented Programming in Python? (Choose two.)

A Python package named pypack includes a module named pymod.py which contains a function named pyfun().
Which of the following snippets will let you invoke the function? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. The constructor’s first parameter identifies an object currently being created
C. The constructor can be invoked directly under strictly defined circumstances

comments.content:
Correct. Explanation for incorrect options:
❌ B. Super-class constructor is invoked implicitly during constructor execution.
This is false because the superclass constructor is not invoked automatically. If a class inherits from another class and its constructor needs to be called, it must be explicitly invoked using super().__init__().
❌ D. The constructor cannot use the default values of the parameters.
This is false because Python allows default values in the constructor

choices.C: the constructor can be invoked directly under strictly defined circumstances
choices.A: the constructor’s first parameter identifies an object currently being created
choices.B: super-class constructor is invoked implicitly during constructor execution
choices.D: the constructor cannot use the default values of the parameters
